body_html:
Actually I'm trying to use convoluational operations (especially Conv1d) to natural language processing application, and it is quite common that an input data has shape (batch, length, hidden_size) in NLP tasks.
If the overhead resulted by "transpose-contiguous" is negligible, I would use that kind of approach without worry, but I don't know much about the overhead.

body:
Actually I'm trying to use convoluational operations (especially Conv1d) to natural language processing application, and it is quite common that an input data has shape (batch, length, hidden_size) in NLP tasks.
If the overhead resulted by "transpose-contiguous" is negligible, I would use that kind of approach without worry, but I don't know much about the overhead.
